boat.name: Phyllis
boat.full_description: The Royal Mersey Restricted Class originated in 1906 and the first example was Avis designed by GH Wilmer using a hull form based on the very successful Lancashire nobby fishing boats. Phyllis was commissioned by FW Whitely, a longstanding member of the RMYC and a restricted class yachtsman. She was designed by GH Wilmer and completed in June 1913 at Sam Bond's yard in Rockferry. Phylis is built to the RMRC envelope specification but with a slightly shorter length, a slightly heavier build and a deeper keel. FW Whitely is said to have sailed her directly to Hibre Island where his family still keep a summer cottage today.
boat.short_description: Phyllis is the only example of the Royal Mersey Restricted Class currently afloat.

for_sales.sales_text:
The only Royal Mersey Restricted Class yacht afloat, Phyllis, is a 27ft gaff cutter rig (34ft overall).  Completely rebuilt in 2010 professionally by David Moss Boatbuilders to a specification stating to last another 100 years. On completion she was immeditely nominated for the Classic Boat restoration of the year. Phyllis is on the National Small Boat Register (R1387) as a vessel of historical maritime interest. Carvel built, pitch pine on oak frames.

Three berths and Baby Blake toilet. Well fitted out and a pleasure to sail.  You can read about her rebuild, her specification, history and adventures on her dedicated website www.theyachtphyllis.co.uk

She now requires a new custodian to enjoy her fine qualities.
